text:
970.778.8471 | leonamyers18@gmail.com | https://www.linkedin.com/in/leona-myers |


An Ecosystem Science & Sustainability major with an interest in the field of conservation biology, while in school I have been involved in sustainability organizations and have worked in in outdoor leadership positions. In professional settings, I bring qualities of detail analysis and interpersonal skills in order to contribute to my ability to work as a motivated team member. I seek to utilize my expertise in organizations focused on ecological conservation and apply my core competencies which include:

Lifelong Coloradoan with familiarity with surrounding ecosystems
Strong attention to detail with skills in data analysis
Empathetic and considerate worker with motivation and passion for ecosystem science
Ability to work with a diverse group of people of all ages






Junior, Ecosystem Science and Sustainability Major, Conservation Biology Minor GPA: 3.6

Relevant coursework: Ecology, Physical Geography, Information Management for Sustainability, Biology of Organisms (with lab), Intro to Geospatial Science, Sustainability Science, Sustainable Watersheds, Intro to System Theory of Sustainability, Food, Environment, and Social Justice




Freshman, Environmental Engineering

Relevant coursework: Chemistry I (with lab), Chemistry II (with lab), Calculus I, Calculus II, Physics I, Environmental Ethics, Intro to Environmental Engineering Analysis

title: Leona Myers
text:
About Me
I am a passionate and driven third-year student at Colorado State University, majoring in Ecosystem Science and Sustainability with a minor in Conservation Biology. My work is defined by empathy, curiosity, and a deep commitment to understanding ecological systems and conservation challenges. I am empathetic, striving to understand the interconnectedness of ecosystems and the people who interact with them. Passionate about environmental issues, I am deeply motivated to contribute to solutions for conservation and sustainability. Focused on creating meaningful, data-driven change, I approach my research with an impact-oriented mindset. I also believe in the power of collaboration, valuing teamwork and the exchange of ideas to make a greater impact. I am particularly interested in exploring the intersection of ecology, conservation, and sustainability through data science and citizen science. My research often seeks to understand how human activities influence ecosystems and aims to communicate scientific findings effectively to drive conservation outcomes. This platform is designed to connect with researchers, conservation professionals, and fellow students who share a passion for ecology and sustainability. I hope to engage with others working in areas like plant ecology, disturbance ecology, and phenological research, all with the goal of preserving our planet.

title: Projects
text: In the Spring of 2025 I took a class Quantitative Reasoning class based in R. I wrote some code, and did some cool data science. Here is a collection of them!

title: Projects
text:
Minnesota Tree Growth Lab
I have learned from this lab how to manipulate and summarize data using the dplyr package. This included practicing key functions such as filter(), select(), mutate(), group_by(), and summarise() to efficiently explore and analyze datasets.

title: Projects
text:
COVID Wrangling Lab
I have learned from this lab how to apply data wrangling and visualization skills using a large-scale COVID-19 dataset curated by the New York Times. This included working with county-level data on cases and deaths across the full timeline of the pandemic, helping me better understand trends and patterns in public health data.

library(magick)

title: Projects
text:
LTER Network Data Lab
I have learned from this lab how to perform basic statistical tests in R, including chi-square tests, t-tests, and correlation analyses. By working with data from the Long-Term Ecological Research (LTER) Network, I gained experience analyzing ecological data collected over long time periods and across broad spatial scales.

library(magick)

title: Projects
text:
Machine Learning in Hydrology Lab
I have learned from this lab how to apply predictive modeling techniques in hydrology using the tidymodels framework and the CAMELS dataset. This included gaining experience in building models to analyze catchment and meteorological data for large-scale hydrologic studies.

title: Projects
text:
ML Tuning Lab
I have learned from this lab how to build a complete machine learning pipeline for a regression problem using the tidymodels package. This included understanding the importance of data splitting and applying each step of the modeling process in a structured workflow.

title: Projects
text:
Distances and Projections Lab
This lab focuses on understanding the structure and storage of sf, sfc, and sfg spatial features in R, along with key concepts like distance calculations and coordinate transformations. It also builds on skills in data wrangling, visualization, and documentation using Quarto and GitHub.
